ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder (CAPD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports significant difficulty hearing in noise and has a history of meningitis, despite normal peripheral hearing sensitivity.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Normal Peripheral Hearing
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Pure-tone thresholds, speech recognition in quiet, and immittance testing are all within normal limits.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To evaluate speech recognition threshold and word recognition in quiet.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and check for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates normal peripheral hearing sensitivity bilaterally with excellent speech recognition in quiet. Middle ear function is normal, as indicated by Type A tympanograms and present acoustic reflexes with negative decay. These results do not explain the patient's reported difficulty hearing in noise, pointing towards a potential central auditory processing deficit.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally with thresholds between 0-20 dB HL across all frequencies.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT was 15 dB HL bilaterally, in agreement with PTA. WRS was 100% at 60 dB HL bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms bilaterally (Right: 1.0 mL, 0.8 mmho; Left: 1.1 mL, 0.4 mmho).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes present from 500 to 4,000 Hz. Reflex decay was negative.

counseling_actions: Counseled on hearing evaluation results indicating normal peripheral hearing.
Discussed the discrepancy between normal test results and subjective difficulty in noise, suggesting potential central auditory processing issues.

escalation.destination: Specialized evaluation for Central Auditory Processing Disorder (CAPD)
escalation.rationale_short: Patient reports significant difficulty in noise and has a history of meningitis, which are not explained by the normal routine audiogram.

follow_up_plan.objective: Review results of CAPD and HAT evaluations to determine further management.
